poem:
**Rising Notes**

In the mosaic of morning,  
I glimpse him, Jermaine—  
a symphony woven from soot and song,  
where rhythms forge pathways  
through cobblestone echoes  
and bitter winds.  
Black ink on rough parchment,  
his voice deciphers the skyline,  
ascending notes  
to an uncharted altitude,  
where clouds hold the cries  
of futures yet unspoken.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wretch 32: ‘It’s a difficult ride for Black people in this country’ Over the past two decades, Wretch 32, real name Jermaine Scott, has established himself as a pioneering figure in British rap. From his rise in the underbellies of an early-millennium rap and grime scene, to his mainstream success and songs with the likes of Ed Sheeran and Emeli Sandé, Stormzy and Giggs, he is among the handful of UK rappers who have scaled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Wretch 32: ‘It’s a difficult ride for Black people in this country’ Over the past two decades, Wretch 32, real name Jermaine Scott, has established himself as a pioneering figure in British rap.
